name: Annie Get Your Quiz | Annie Get Your Gun | 15 Questions

questions.text: Complete the lyric to "There's No Business Like Show Business". "The headaches, the heartaches, the backaches, the ______".
questions.explanation:
flops.

	This line is sung by Dolly in the show. Dolly was played by Valerie Wright.

questions.text: According to the song "Doin' What Comes Natur'lly" in what state does Annie's uncle live who "can't even write his name"?
questions.explanation:
Texas.

	This is one of my favorite songs in the show. Annie sings it to explain why she doesn't need to have a lot of education.

questions.text: According to the song "The Girl that I Marry" what kind of flower will Frank's girl wear?
questions.explanation:
gardenia.

	"Her nails will be polished and in her hair she'll wear a gardenia and I'll be there."

questions.text: Complete the lyrics to "You Can't Get a Man With a Gun." ""Oh you can't get a hug from a mug with a ______".
questions.explanation:
slug.

	Poor Annie, she's in love with Frank, but he's not too fond of her being a wild west woman who's good with a gun.

questions.text: In the reprise of "There's No Business Like Show Business" complete this last line of the song. "Let's go on with the ________!"
questions.explanation:
show.

	Did you know that "There's No Business Like Show Business" is now considered the theme song of theatre? It is definitely a fitting theme.

questions.text: Who is the main male character that sings "I'll Share it All With You" with Winnie?
questions.explanation:
Tommy.

	Tommy Keeler was played by Andrew Palermo.

questions.text: What kind of lullaby does Annie sing?
questions.explanation:
moonshine.

	This is such a beautiful song.

questions.text: Compete the lyric from "They Say it's Wonderful." Rumors fly and they often leave a _______."
questions.explanation:
doubt.

	This song is so romantic and quite true.

questions.text: Complete these lyrics with the appropriate two words from "My Defenses are Down." "I went into the fight like a ___________, but I came out like a ________."
questions.explanation:
lion lamb.

	This song is song by Frank Butler.

questions.text: Who is Annie Oakley in love with?
questions.explanation:
Frank Butler & Butler & Frank.

	Frank Butler was played by Tom Wopat.

questions.text: Complete the lyric from the song "Who Do you Love, I Hope." "Is it the butcher who brought you a steak? Say that it is and I'll ____."
questions.explanation:
die.

	Tommy and Winnie are in love.

questions.text: According to one of the songs in ACT II, what does Annie have in the morning?
questions.explanation:
sun.

	"I got the sun in the morning and the moon at night."

questions.text: Who wants an old fashioned wedding?
questions.explanation:
Frank.

	"We'll have an old fashioned wedding, blessed in the good old fashioned way." This is my favorite song in the show, too bad it's not in the movie version of "Annie Get Your Gun."  For those of you that said Annie, she is the one who wants to get married "in a big church with bridesmaids and flower girls."

questions.text: Where does Annie want to have her "big reception"?
questions.explanation:
Waldorf.

	She wants a wedding "like the Vanderbilts have. Everything big not small." They could compromise and have a traditional big wedding.

questions.text: Can either Frank or Annie bake a pie?
questions.explanation:
No.

	This answer can be found in the song "Anything You Can Do I Can Do Better".
